alert.note: Alert for Caruthers - San Joaquin - Selma; Fresno-Clovis; Los Banos - Dos Palos; Merced - Madera - Mendota; West Side of Fresno and Kings Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 21 at 3:30PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Madera and west central Fresno Counties through 415 PM PDT... At 328 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mendota, or 22 miles southwest of Madera, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Brief heavy rain and lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kerman, Mendota and Biola. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Brief Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and could lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
